Abstract: This literature synthesis explores the multilevel determinants influencing digital health equity, emphasizing the intersection of health technology and social determinants of health. By analyzing existing research, the study identifies key barriers and facilitators impacting equitable access to digital health resources. The findings highlight the role of socioeconomic status, education, and geographic location in shaping digital health disparities. Additionally, the synthesis underscores the importance of policy interventions and community engagement in promoting inclusive digital health solutions. This work aims to advance the field by providing a comprehensive understanding of the complex factors affecting digital health equity, ultimately guiding future research and policy development to bridge the digital divide in healthcare.
